channel.title: Wei Fang on Wei Fang
channel.description: Recent content in Wei Fang on Wei Fang

item.title: Multi-Label Zero-Shot Learning with Structured Knowledge Graphs
Multi-Label Zero-Shot Recognition with Knowledge Graphs
item.description: Inspired by the way humans utilize semantic knowledge between objects of interests, we propose a novel deep learning framework that incorporates knowledge graphs for describing the relationships between multiple labels to achieve multi-label zero-shot learning (ML-ZSL).

item.title: Sketch-based Image Retrieval across Art Styles
item.description:
In this project, we try to perform cross-domain image retrieval across different art styles using sketches as queries. Given a sketch image and a target art domain, we aim to retrieve images that are semantically similar in that particular art domain.

We surveyed a few papers and a dataset by Adobe and Cornell Tech in the proceedings of this yearâ€™s ICCV conference (ICCV 2017). The Behance Artistic Media (BAM) dataset consists of images of 9 kinds of objects for 7 different art styles such as oil paint or vector art. We select a subset containing 5 content classes: bicycle, bird, cars, cat, and dog, as our retrieval database. During training, we utilized sketches from the Quick, Draw! dataset as queries, and we developed a demo system to test retrieval results for hand-drawn sketches. We approached this problem by utilizing triplet convolutional neural networks, mainly based on this paper.

Here are our presentation slides.

Reference

  • BAM! The Behance Artistic Media Dataset for Recognition Beyond Photography. ICCV 2017.
  • Sketching with Style: Visual Search with Sketches and Aesthetic Context. ICCV 2017.

item.title: Modular Chatbot
item.description:
In this project, we built a modular dialogue system with deep learning techniques for the task of assisting people in department stores.

Here is our poster.

item.title: Hierarchical Attention Model for Improved Machine Comprehension of Spoken Content
Question Answering for Listening Comprehension
item.description: Here is a short talk I gave on our group’s recent work on speech question answering.

item.title: MasterView (VR System)
item.description:
In the 2016 HackNTU Hackathon, our team developed MasterView, a virtual reality system that shows the expert’s moves in first-person perspective so the user can imitate and practice.

Here’s a demo video of our system, and here’s our presentation slides in Mandarin Chinese.

item.title: Slither.AR (AR Game)
item.description:
Using common and well-known development tools, we transform slither.io, a game based on “Snake”, into an interactive augmented-reality game.

The details about this project can be found in our project report.

item.title: Visual Question Answering
item.description: Here is our report and here are our slides.

item.title: Aspect-Based Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Here is a report on our results for the aspect-based sentiment analysis task in SemEval 2016.

item.title: Large Scale Equivalence Checking and Functional Correction
item.description: We participated in the 2015 CAD Contest hosted by IEEE/ACM International Conference on Computer Aided Design (ICCAD 2015). In Problem B, we developed a system to identify equivalent cuts in both equivalent and nonequivalent circuits for design partitioning.

item.title: uHu - a Resale Service
item.description: At the 2016 HackNTU Hackathon, our team built a second-hand trading platform, uhu, which provided services for booking, notifications, and filtering functions based on Facebook trading groups, in under 42 hours. Our presentation slides (in Mandarin Chinese) can be found here.
